edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck

Class GameCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.GameCanvas

  • public class GameCanvas
extends java.lang.Object
    Primary view class for the game, abstracting the basic graphics calls. This version of GameCanvas only supports both rectangular and polygonal Sprite drawing. It also supports a debug mode that draws polygonal outlines. However, that mode must be done in a separate begin/end pass.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GameCanvas.BlendState
      Enumeration of supported BlendStates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameCanvas

        public GameCanvas()
        Creates a new GameCanvas determined by the application configuration. Width, height, and fullscreen are taken from the LWGJApplicationConfig object used to start the application. This constructor initializes all of the necessary graphics objects.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Changes the width of this canvas This method raises an IllegalStateException if called while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).
        Parameters:

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns whether this canvas is currently fullscreen.
        Returns:
        whether this canvas is currently fullscreen.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean value,
                          boolean desktop)
        Sets whether or not this canvas should change to fullscreen. If desktop is true, it will use the current desktop resolution for fullscreen, and not the width and height set in the configuration object at the start of the application. This parameter has no effect if fullscreen is false. This method raises an IllegalStateException if called while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).
        Parameters:
        value - Whether this canvas should change to fullscreen.
        desktop - Whether to use the current desktop resolution

      • resize

        public void resize()
        Resets the SpriteBatch camera when this canvas is resized. If you do not call this when the window is resized, you will get weird scaling issues.

      • getBlendState

        public GameCanvas.BlendState getBlendState()
        Returns the current color blending state for this canvas. Textures draw to this canvas will be composited according to the rules of this blend state.
        Returns:
        the current color blending state for this canvas

      • setBlendState

        public void setBlendState(GameCanvas.BlendState state)
        Sets the color blending state for this canvas. Any texture draw subsequent to this call will use the rules of this blend state to composite with other textures. Unlike the other setters, if it is perfectly safe to use this setter while drawing is active (e.g. in-between a begin-end pair).
        Parameters:
        state - the color blending rule

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the screen so we can start a new animation frame

      • begin

        public void begin(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
        Start a standard drawing sequence. Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.
        Parameters:
        affine - the global transform apply to the camera

      • begin

        public void begin(float sx,
                  float sy)
        Start a standard drawing sequence. Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.
        Parameters:
        sx - the amount to scale the x-axis
        sy - the amount to scale the y-axis

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Start a standard drawing sequence. Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.

      • end

        public void end()
        Ends a drawing sequence, flushing textures to the graphics card.

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image,
                 float x,
                 float y)
        Draws the tinted texture at the given position. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        image - The texture to draw
        x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        Draws the texture at the given position to the given size
        Parameters:
        image - Texture to draw
        x - The x-coordinate of bottom left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of bottom left corner
        width - The width to draw
        height - The height to draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image,

                 float y,

The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float ox,
                 float oy,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        Draws the tinted texture at the given position. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        image - The texture to draw
        tint - The color tint
        ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
        y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
        width - The texture width
        height - The texture height

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float ox,
                 float oy,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float angle,
                 float sx,
                 float sy)
        Draws the tinted texture with the given transformations The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        image - The texture to draw
        tint - The color tint
        ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
        y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
        angle - The rotation angle (in degrees) about the origin.
        sx - The x-axis scaling factor
        sy - The y-axis scaling factor

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture image,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float ox,
                 float oy,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 transform)
        Draws the tinted texture with the given transformations The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        image - The texture to draw
        tint - The color tint
        ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        transform - The image transform

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region,
                 float x,
                 float y)
        Draws the tinted texture region (filmstrip) at the given position. A texture region is a single texture file that can hold one or more textures. It is used for filmstrip animation. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        region - The texture to draw
        x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        Draws the tinted texture at the given position. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. Unless otherwise transformed by the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)), the texture will be unscaled. The bottom left of the texture will be positioned at the given coordinates. region
        Parameters:
        region - The texture to draw
        tint - The color tint
        x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - The texture width
        height - The texture height

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float ox,
                 float oy,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float angle,
                 float sx,
                 float sy)
        Draws the tinted texture region (filmstrip) with the given transformations A texture region is a single texture file that can hold one or more textures. It is used for filmstrip animation. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        region - The texture to draw
        tint - The color tint
        ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        x - The x-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
        y - The y-coordinate of the texture origin (on screen)
        angle - The rotation angle (in degrees) about the origin.
        sx - The x-axis scaling factor
        sy - The y-axis scaling factor

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion region,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float ox,
                 float oy,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
        Draws the tinted texture with the given transformations The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        region - The region to draw
        tint - The color tint
        ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        affine - The image transform

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region,
                 float x,
                 float y)
        Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        region - The polygon to draw
        x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        region - The polygon to draw
        tint - The color tint
        x - The x-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - The texture width
        height - The texture height

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.PolygonRegion region,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color tint,
                 float ox,
                 float oy,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
        Draws the polygonal region with the given transformations A polygon region is a texture region with attached vertices so that it draws a textured polygon. The polygon vertices are relative to the texture file. The texture colors will be multiplied by the given color. This will turn any white into the given color. Other colors will be similarly affected. The transformations are BEFORE after the global transform (@see begin(Affine2)). As a result, the specified texture origin will be applied to all transforms (both the local and global). The local transformations in this method are applied in the following order: scaling, then rotation, then translation (e.g. placement at (sx,sy)).
        Parameters:
        region - The polygon to draw
        tint - The color tint
        ox - The x-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        oy - The y-coordinate of texture origin (in pixels)
        affine - The image transform

      • drawText

        public void drawText(java.lang.String text,
                     com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font,
                     float x,
                     float y)
        Draws text on the screen.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to draw
        font - The font to use
        x - The x-coordinate of the lower-left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the lower-left corner

        Draws text centered on the screen.

      • beginDebug

        public void beginDebug(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2 affine)
        Start the debug drawing sequence. Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.
        Parameters:
        affine - the global transform apply to the camera

      • beginDebug

        public void beginDebug(float sx,
                       float sy)
        Start the debug drawing sequence. Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.
        Parameters:
        sx - the amount to scale the x-axis
        sy - the amount to scale the y-axis

      • beginDebug

        public void beginDebug()
        Start the debug drawing sequence. Nothing is flushed to the graphics card until the method end() is called.

      • endDebug

        public void endDebug()
        Ends the debug drawing sequence, flushing textures to the graphics card.

      • drawPhysics

        public void drawPhysics(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.CircleShape shape,
                        com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color,
                        float x,
                        float y)
        Draws the outline of the given shape in the specified color The position of the circle is ignored. Only the radius is used. To move the circle, change the x and y parameters.
        Parameters:
        shape - The Box2d shape
        color - The outline color
        x - The x-coordinate of the shape position
        y - The y-coordinate of the shape position
